message_1: Let P represent the statement "I study math every day" and Q represent the statement "I complete all my assignments on time." If P is true and Q is false, what is the truth value of the statement "If I study math every day, then I complete all my assignments on time"?
message_2:
The statement "If I study math every day, then I complete all my assignments on time" is a conditional statement represented as P → Q. In this case, P is true and Q is false. 

A conditional statement is false only when the antecedent (P) is true and the consequent (Q) is false. Since P is true and Q is false in this situation, the statement P → Q is false. So, the truth value of the statement "If I study math every day, then I complete all my assignments on time" is false.
